title.narrative: COMMUNITIES IN RURAL AREAS USE SUSTAINED RESILIENT BASIC WATER SUPPLY SERVICES

description.narrative: Communities, particularly in rural areas, use sustained resilient â€œbasicâ€ water supply services free from contamination, which contributes to Safe And Equitable Water, Sanitation And Hygiene Services And Practices, Water, Sanitation And Hygiene Systems And Empowerment Of Communities, Water, Sanitation And Hygiene Systems And Empowerment Of Communities (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Households in rural and urban areas have increased access to safe, â€œbasicâ€ and sustainable Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) services in emergency and non- emergencysituations.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Communities, particularly in rural areas, use sustained resilient ?basic? water supply services free from contamination

description.narrative: During 2021, UNICEF engaged with MININFRA, the Ministry of Environment and REMA on preparatory work to strengthen the resilience of WASH infrastructure, especially water supply systems, in Rwanda. A climate risk assessment for WASH was undertaken and work on a climate rationale for WASH, plus the development of guidelines on climate-resilient WASH programming commenced. Work on the rehabilitation of priority water supply systems, serving over 40,000 people, which were damaged by heavy rainfall and flooding during 2020, began in partnership with WASAC and World Vision. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:30/12/2021
